title: IF a bad dua is made against me, can it affect me if I did not do anything wrong and how is dua answ
transcript:
[Questioner] from the UK is our first caller all 
right so there are some things in the religion   that could affect the person even if they are not 
aware or know about them for example most people   know about the fact that someone can make bad dua 
against them and there is a possibility that this   the duacould be answered even if they have not 
done nothing wrong to them and are saying athkar   in the morning and evening such as Bismillah three 
times in the morning and evening and I say in the   free quls three times in the morning evening so a 
lot of people know about this but a lot of people   don't know as well so my question is say if bad 
dua is made against a person who did nothing   wrong who does not have and this person does not 
have any knowledge of it and does not know that it   could affect him would Allah be more lenient in 
not answering the dua that is made against them   compared to a person who knows about it and knows 
it could possibly affect him first of all is a   weapon which an individual can use against others 
or in the favor of others and when you make Dua   Allah either answers it or deflects harm that was 
predestined to come your way or stores it for you   on the day of judgment and we've answered so many 
similar situations before so when you make Dua   for yourself or for others this is what 
happens now if you make Dua against others   there are a possibility of two either you are 
oppressed and you're making Dua against the   one who had oppressed you and in this case Allah 
azzawajal deals with your Dua in the three ways   either answers it or deflects harm that's coming 
your way or stores it on the day of judgment   the second option is that you were 
not wronged you were not oppressed   rather you are doing it unjustly and you're 
transgressing by oppressing others with your Dua   in this case Allah does not accept nor answer your 
Dua because it includes either transgression or   the severing of kinship and this is something that 
Allah does not answer or accept at the end of the   day as long as you have done your due diligence 
and you observed your athkar in the morning   and the evening after Salah before going to bed 
before leaving the house these are athkar that are   supposed to protect you you are with the grace of 
Allah protected unless Allah Wills something else   for a reason that we cannot see or understand or 
comprehend at this moment but we trust Allah's   judgment and Allah's wisdom and we are content 
with it and I hope this answers your question and have you ever taken a counseling session with

if they can affirm by Allah that they cannot   afford it because they're poor I'll give them 
one free session without a problem a full half   an hour so come to me and let's speak about 
it inshallah within the following two days   or three days I will uh try and seek Allah's 
guidance to solve the problem once and for All thank you
